qas.question: The US Constitution says what to amendments?

answers.text: provides that no state may be deprived of equal representation in the senate without its consent

qas.question: What happens when certain constitutional amendments cannot occur?

answers.text: cannot occur without the unanimous consent of all states or of a particular state

qas.question: Any amendment in the Canadian constitution that needs to be modified, needs to do what first?

answers.text: would require unanimous consent of the provinces.

qas.question: What is the German basic law?

answers.text: provides that no amendment is admissible at all that would abolish the federal system.

plausible_answers.text: provides that no state may be deprived of equal representation in the senate without its consent

qas.question: The UN Constitution says what to amendments?

plausible_answers.text: provides that no state may be deprived of equal representation in the senate without its consent

qas.question: The US Constitution doesn't say what to amendments?

plausible_answers.text: would require unanimous consent of the provinces

qas.question: Any amendment in the Canadian constitution that needs to be modified, needs to do what last?

plausible_answers.text: without the unanimous consent of all states or of a particular state

qas.question: What happens when certain constitutional amendments can occur?

plausible_answers.text: provides that no amendment is admissible at all that would abolish the federal system

qas.question: What is the German advanced law?

context: Some federal constitutions also provide that certain constitutional amendments <a1_0>cannot occur <b7_0>without the unanimous consent of all states or of a particular state<b7_0/><a1_0/>. The US constitution <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>provides that no state may be deprived of equal representation in the senate without its consent<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>. In Australia, if a proposed amendment will specifically impact one or more states, then it must be endorsed in the referendum held in each of those states. Any amendment to the Canadian constitution that would modify the role of the monarchy <a2_0><b6_0>would require unanimous consent of the provinces<b6_0/>.<a2_0/> The German Basic Law <a3_0><b8_0>provides that no amendment is admissible at all that would abolish the federal system<b8_0/>.
